definition: to fight over/to rush/to scramble/to grab/to rob/to snatch
hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]

sentences.english: You are a good catch if you are self-reliant.
sentences.chinese: 如果你是一個獨立自主的人，你就是一個搶手貨。

sentences.english: Ice-cream moon cakes are selling like hot cakes.
sentences.chinese: 冰祺淋月餅是最爲搶手貨。

sentences.english: Now traditional Chinese medicine to improve one's immunity has become a fast-selling product.
sentences.chinese: 現在增強免疫力的中藥成了搶手貨。

sentences.english: You are a good catch if you are honest and can be trusted.
sentences.chinese: 如果你能誠實且被信任，你就是個搶手貨。

sentences.english: But Sarah Palin is still expected to be a popular choice.
sentences.chinese: 但是佩琳的裝束估計會成爲搶手貨。

sentences.english: The services of China's Zheng Zhi are in demand with the English Premier League (EPL).
sentences.chinese: 中國球員鄭智最近成了英超球隊的搶手貨。

sentences.english: But even at such high prices, memberships are still eagerly sought.
sentences.chinese: 但是即使是如此高的價格，會員資格仍然是搶手貨。

definition: just a very few (idiom); tiny number/just a handful/not many at all/You count them on your fingers.
lit. to draw a gourd from the model (idiom)/fig. to copy sth mechanically without attempt at originality
variant of 戰略伙伴|战略伙伴[zhan4 lu:e4 huo3 ban4]
